name: 7in Thumbless Goodman (Vinyl Toy)
description:
You may be wondering... "Who is Oscar Goodman?" Well... let me explain. Goodman once was just a ordinary attorney for the Las Vegas mob scene in the 90's but when he was elected Mayor of the GREAT city of Las Vegas he took his tie off and showed people how crazy he really is. A spokesperson for Bombay Saphire Gin and an avid alcoholic, in Goodmans tenure as Mayor he advocated alcoholism in elementary schools and hated graffiti. That's where I come in. Oscar Goodman stated that graffiti writers who are caught should have there thumbs cut off in a public forum. Well what better way to show homage to the man who helped push countless numbers of graffiti writers to keep on vandalising by making the Ex-Mayor of Las Vegas into a custom 7in vinyl toy.
Toy is made from a standard Kidrobot 7inch Munny and comes with:

-Custom box and "Birth Certificate"

-Removable glasses

-Original sketch for the signed and numbered toy

-???Mystery accessory???

So get one today! Sold Out? Contact me for special request on making a toy.

name: "Clicked Up Vol.1" 24x36
description: A 24x36 framed illustration, showing love to those who show me. I was only able to fit half of my crew mates on this page, hoping "Clicked Up Vol.2" will fiish up the names... Mainly used black and silver sharpies, also added a colored SOA AUB BSA down the center of the piece. I added the waldo as a joke.. try and find your name! Once it was all finished I stenciled out some names and layered them over the top with a transparent black.

name: "Trainspotting" DUAL 16x20
description: I started out by cutting a 40in long and 24in wide piece of paper and then sketched the frame I would be drawing in at 16x40. Then drew a R-Box boxcar as best as I could and recreated a piece on it. Black white and about 4 shades of grey were all the colors used on this piece. Once it was all drawn I cut it down the middle to produce TWO 16x20. Spent about a week on this one.

name: "BREAKING THROUGH" 16x20
description:
Black sharpie and grey copics on hand-cut paper, framed and ready to hang! 
The series of black and white illustrations I'm selling cheap in hopes to buy a large new set of colored markers to do full colored, large scale illustrations. This is for fans of my art and those who would like to support me. All black and white illustrations will come with a free large sticker pack to show my thanks for your support. Thank you. I did also use a little light blue for shadowing on the letters.

name: Santa Fe Shock Control [HO Scale]
description: A hand weathered HO scale model train with a Savme piece on one panel. All weathering and art done by me, the piece is done in acrylics.
